question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_state_checkpoint_output()] [Panic-based DoS] Can an attacker trigger concurrent calls to set_state_checkpoint_output() from multiple threads, causing the expect() at line 79 to panic and crash validator nodes, resulting in loss of liveness? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_ledger_update_output()] [Panic-based DoS] Can malicious code paths invoke set_ledger_update_output() multiple times on the same PartialStateComputeResult instance, triggering the expect() panic at line 91 and causing validator crashes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Race condition] Are there race conditions where multiple threads could simultaneously attempt to set state_checkpoint_output or ledger_update_output OnceCell fields, leading to non-deterministic panic behavior across validators and causing network partition? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_state_checkpoint_output()] [State inconsistency] Can the lack of atomicity between setting state_checkpoint_output and validating its consistency with execution_output allow attackers to inject mismatched state data, causing validators to diverge on state roots? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_ledger_update_output()] [State inconsistency] Is there validation that ledger_update_output's transaction accumulator matches the execution_output's committed transactions, or can attackers provide inconsistent outputs leading to incorrect ledger state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [State corruption] Can get_complete_result() be called when ledger_update_output is set but state_checkpoint_output is not, bypassing the expect() at line 100 due to timing issues and creating incomplete StateComputeResult objects? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: expect_complete_result()] [Panic attack] Can attackers force code paths that call expect_complete_result() at line 108 before all outputs are set, causing validator nodes to panic and creating a denial-of-service condition? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [Pipeline violation] Does the code enforce that state_checkpoint_output must be set before ledger_update_output, or can out-of-order pipeline execution at line 95-104 lead to state inconsistencies across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: ensure_state_checkpoint_output()] [Missing validation] When ensure_state_checkpoint_output() returns an error at line 64, are there code paths that fail to handle this gracefully, potentially committing partial state and causing state divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: ensure_ledger_update_output()] [Missing validation] Can ensure_ledger_update_output() at line 84 return an error in scenarios where the ledger update should be present, allowing transactions to be executed without proper ledger commitment? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: has_reconfiguration()] [Epoch transition bypass] Can attackers manipulate the execution_output.next_epoch_state field to make has_reconfiguration() return false when a reconfiguration should occur, preventing validator set updates and allowing old validators to maintain control? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: has_reconfiguration()] [Consensus failure] If has_reconfiguration() incorrectly returns true due to corrupted next_epoch_state data at line 58, can this trigger premature epoch transitions causing validator set inconsistencies and network partition? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: has_reconfiguration()] [State validation gap] Is there validation that when has_reconfiguration() returns true, the corresponding state_checkpoint_output and ledger_update_output contain proper epoch boundary markers, or can mismatched epoch data cause consensus failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Reconfiguration race] Can race conditions occur during reconfiguration where one validator sees has_reconfiguration()=true while another sees false for the same block, causing validators to apply different epoch transitions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new_empty()] [State bypass] Can malicious code invoke new_empty() with arbitrary ledger_summary data at line 33, bypassing normal execution validation and creating forged state compute results that appear valid? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new_empty()] [Initialization vulnerability] Does new_empty() at lines 38-48 properly validate that the provided ledger_summary matches the current blockchain state, or can attackers provide stale/forged summaries to create inconsistent empty results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new_empty()] [OnceCell assumption violation] The comment at line 34-35 mentions 'make sure we don't leave any OnceCell unset' - can failure to follow this pattern in new() versus new_empty() lead to code paths that assume OnceCell values are set when they're not? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new_empty()] [State inconsistency] Can new_empty() be called with a ledger_summary that doesn't match the execution_output created at line 36, leading to mismatched state roots between the execution state and checkpoint state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: result_state()] [State access race] Can concurrent access to result_state() at line 68 while execution_output is being modified lead to reading inconsistent LedgerState data due to lack of synchronization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: ensure_result_state_summary()] [Dependency validation] Does ensure_result_state_summary() at lines 71-74 validate that the state_summary is consistent with result_state(), or can these diverge causing validators to commit to different state roots? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Clone safety] Since PartialStateComputeResult is Clone (line 17), can cloning create multiple instances that independently set OnceCell fields, leading to inconsistent state across different clones used by different components? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [Clone overhead] Does the cloning of execution_output, state_checkpoint_output, and ledger_update_output at lines 97-102 create excessive memory overhead that could be exploited to cause out-of-memory conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new_empty()] [Panic on first set] Can the expect('First set.') at lines 42 and 48 ever fail if new_empty() is called on a reused or improperly initialized instance, causing unexpected validator crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_state_checkpoint_output()] [Error propagation gap] Should set_state_checkpoint_output() at line 76 return a Result instead of panicking, to allow graceful error recovery when double-setting occurs due to retry logic or parallel execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_ledger_update_output()] [Error propagation gap] Should set_ledger_update_output() at line 88 return a Result instead of panicking, to prevent validator crashes when pipeline stages are executed in unexpected orders? (Medium)
